meanings.definition: Mercy or leniency shown towards someone who is guilty or deserving of punishment.
meanings.sent1: The judge showed clemency towards the first-time offender.
meanings.sent2: The king's clemency spared the prisoner from a harsh sentence.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's clemency towards late homework made the students very grateful.
meanings.sent4: In the face of danger, the hero's clemency towards the villain surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The clemency of the kind-hearted queen became legendary in the kingdom.

meanings.definition: A disposition to show mercy, especially towards an offender or enemy.
meanings.sent1: Her clemency towards those who wronged her was truly admirable.
meanings.sent2: The soldier's clemency towards the captured enemy softened hearts on both sides.
meanings.sent3: The cat's clemency towards the mouse in the game of chase made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The sun's clemency towards the flowers allowed them to bloom beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The clemency of the wise old sage brought peace to the warring factions.
